skillTree.name: Authority of Change
skillTree.description: Tzeentch's authority is absolute, for infinite change is the very nature of Chaos.

effects.description:
Nurgle Authority: -2
	(Lord's army)

Tzeentch Authority: +2
	(Lord's army)

Nurgle Authority: -2
	(Lord's army)

Tzeentch Authority: +3
	(Lord's army)

Nurgle Authority: -3
	(Lord's army)

Tzeentch Authority: +4
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Voice of the Dark Gods
skillTree.description: This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.

effects.description: Leadership aura size: +40%

skillTree.name: Hearts of Iron
skillTree.description: The followers of Chaos need not to rest, they march on with iron hearts desperate to harvest souls.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -15%
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Invulnerable Through Change
skillTree.description: With just a wave of the hand, projectiles fired at this servant of Tchar are turned from sharp and pointy to soft and entirely harmless.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10%

skillTree.name: Mentor
skillTree.description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Sword & Sorcery
skillTree.description: With the body of a brute and the skills of a sorcerer, every strike is imbued with mighty strength and vile magics.

effects.description: Enables warpflame attacks
Barrier hit points: +200

skillTree.name: Twist of Fate
skillTree.description: The Forsaken flock to Vilitch, basking in the aura of flux that swirls around the Twisted Twin.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +15% for Forsaken of Tzeentch and Spawn of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -50% for Forsaken and Spawn of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)
Passive ability: "Paragon of Change"

skillTree.name: Mindwipe
skillTree.description: Tugging at the loose strands in the minds of enemies and allies alike, Vilitch bends all to his will.

effects.description:
Changing of the Ways cost: -50% for "Muddle Minds"
	(enemy armies in local province)
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Treason of Tzeentch"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Treason of Tzeentch Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Pawns of Fortune
skillTree.description: "Yes, yes, you can have them back when I'm done with them."

effects.description: Request army cost: -25%
Diplomatic relations: +20 with Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Beastmen and Norsca

Souls gained from own casualties: +25%
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Mine, All Mine!
skillTree.description: "Take it all and find more still! Everything is not enough!"

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +50%

Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 10%
	(all characters)
Income from post-battle loot: +10%

skillTree.name: Master of Misrule
skillTree.description: As a twisted fusion of diabolic strength and sorcery, Vilitch owes all to the God of Change, and stands against any who would oppose Him.

effects.description:
Tzeentch Authority: +2
	(Lord's army)
Attribute: "Daemonic"
Ability: "Winds of Change"

skillTree.name: Infernal Champion
skillTree.description: The Warriors of Chaos are the playthings of Gods and given many gifts, including formidable fighting skills.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10%

skillTree.name: Devastating Charge
skillTree.description: Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +15
Charge bonus: +30

skillTree.name: Thick-Skinned
skillTree.description: Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.

effects.description: Armour: +7
Armour: +15

skillTree.name: Hard to Hit
skillTree.description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, itâ€™s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.

effects.description: Melee defence: +6
Melee defence: +12

skillTree.name: Deadly Blade
skillTree.description: A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!

effects.description: Melee attack: +6
Melee attack: +12

skillTree.name: Foe-Seeker
skillTree.description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.

effects.description: Ability: "Foe-Seeker"

skillTree.name: Wound-Maker
skillTree.description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10%
Weapon strength: +20%

skillTree.name: Scarred Veteran
skillTree.description: The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.

effects.description: Hit points: +7%
Hit points: +15%

skillTree.name: Indomitable
skillTree.description: The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.

effects.description: Leadership: +6
Leadership: +12

skillTree.name: Blade Shield
skillTree.description: A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.

effects.description: Melee defence: +6
Melee defence: +12

skillTree.name: Deadly Onslaught
skillTree.description: The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.

skillTree.name: Earthing
skillTree.description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -15%

skillTree.name: Magical Reserves
skillTree.description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5
Passive ability: "Greater Arcane Conduit"

skillTree.name: Dominating Presence
skillTree.description: A Chaos Lord dominates â€“ lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)
Character's aura leadership effect: +5

skillTree.name: Chaos Vanguard
skillTree.description: To the Northmen, there is no greater honour than to fight and perish under the gaze of the Gods.

skillTree.description: Breaking bones and ending lives, the armies of Chaos strike like an unholy hammer crashing through their enemies' ranks.

skillTree.name: Monstrous Strength
skillTree.description: Hulks of pure muscle, held upright by unsullied hatred, can crush a man with a frightening lack of effort.

skillTree.name: Legion of Doom
skillTree.description: The legions march forth under the Lord's inscrutable gaze, eager to kill for fear of his wrath.

skillTree.name: Speed & Malice
skillTree.description: The worthiest of Chaos' vanguard are blessed with the most elaborate mutations, which also enable them to move faster for longer.

skillTree.description: Mutations awarded by the Chaos Gods to their followers may look horrific to southerners, but such gifts are prized.

skillTree.description: To devastate one's enemies from afar is the key to controlling the battlefield.

skillTree.name: Route Marcher
skillTree.description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +5%

skillTree.name: Despoilers
skillTree.description: To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
